com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HITreemap

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISeries
        • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HITreemap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HITreemap
extends HISeries
    A treemap series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels: 1. Options for all series in a chart are defined in the [plotOptions.series](plotOptions.series) object. 2. Options for all treemap series are defined in [plotOptions.treemap](plotOptions.treemap). 3. Options for one single series are given in [the series instance array](series.treemap). Highcharts.chart('container', { plotOptions: { series: { // general options for all series }, treemap: { // shared options for all treemap series } }, series: [{ // specific options for this series instance type: 'treemap' }] });

      • setColorByPoint

        public void setColorByPoint(java.lang.Boolean colorByPoint)
        When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

        default:

         false

      • getColorByPoint

        public java.lang.Boolean getColorByPoint()

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(java.lang.Number opacity)
        The opacity of a point in treemap. When a point has children, the visibility of the children is determined by the opacity.

        default:

         0.15

      • getOpacity

        public java.lang.Number getOpacity()

      • setIgnoreHiddenPoint

        public void setIgnoreHiddenPoint(java.lang.Boolean ignoreHiddenPoint)
        Whether to ignore hidden points when the layout algorithm runs. If false, hidden points will leave open spaces.

        default:

         true

      • getIgnoreHiddenPoint

        public java.lang.Boolean getIgnoreHiddenPoint()

      • setLayoutAlgorithm

        public void setLayoutAlgorithm(java.lang.String layoutAlgorithm)
        This option decides which algorithm is used for setting position and dimensions of the points. Can be one of sliceAndDice, stripes, squarified or strip.

        Try it:

         •  SliceAndDice by default
         •  Stripes
         •  Squarified
         •  Strip

        accepted values:

         ["sliceAndDice", "stripes", "squarified", "strip"]

        default:

         sliceAndDice

      • getLayoutAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getLayoutAlgorithm()

      • setLayoutStartingDirection

        public void setLayoutStartingDirection(java.lang.String layoutStartingDirection)
        Defines which direction the layout algorithm will start drawing. Possible values are "vertical" and "horizontal".

        accepted values:

         ["vertical", "horizontal"]

        default:

         vertical

      • getLayoutStartingDirection

        public java.lang.String getLayoutStartingDirection()

      • setLevelIsConstant

        public void setLevelIsConstant(java.lang.Boolean levelIsConstant)
        Used together with the levels and allowDrillToNode options. When set to false the first level visible when drilling is considered to be level one. Otherwise the level will be the same as the tree structure.

        default:

         true

      • getLevelIsConstant

        public java.lang.Boolean getLevelIsConstant()

        public void setColors(java.util.ArrayList<HIColor> colors)

        Set options on specific levels. Takes precedence over series options, but not point options.

        Try it:

         •  Styling dataLabels and borders
         •  Different layoutAlgorithm

      • setInteractByLeaf

        public void setInteractByLeaf(java.lang.Boolean interactByLeaf)
        This option decides if the user can interact with the parent nodes or just the leaf nodes. When this option is undefined, it will be true by default. However when allowDrillToNode is true, then it will be false by default.

        Try it:

         •  False
         •  InteractByLeaf and allowDrillToNode is true

      • getInteractByLeaf

        public java.lang.Boolean getInteractByLeaf()

      • setAllowDrillToNode

        public void setAllowDrillToNode(java.lang.Boolean allowDrillToNode)
        When enabled the user can click on a point which is a parent and zoom in on its children.

        Try it:

         •  Enabled

        default:

         false

      • getAllowDrillToNode

        public java.lang.Boolean getAllowDrillToNode()

      • setAlternateStartingDirection

        public void setAlternateStartingDirection(java.lang.Boolean alternateStartingDirection)
        Enabling this option will make the treemap alternate the drawing direction between vertical and horizontal. The next levels starting direction will always be the opposite of the previous.

        Try it:

         •  Enabled

        default:

         false

      • getAlternateStartingDirection

        public java.lang.Boolean getAlternateStartingDirection()
